metadata.title: CVE-2022-48710 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/radeon: fix a possible null pointer dereference Inradeon_fp_native_mode(), the return value of drm_mode_duplicate() isassigned to mode, which will lead to a NULL pointer dereference on failureof drm_mode_duplicate(). Add a check to avoid npd. The failure status ofdrm_cvt_mode() on the other path is checked too.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2082-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2082.88
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2082-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2082.88
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
